title: What are the latest business news of August 09, 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: Business news #3 - August 09, 2020 1) TikTok is planning to file a federal lawsuit to challenge President Donald Trump’s executive order of banning the video-sharing service from the United States  2) 1.76 million jobs added in July month in the US, which is believed that is more than expected. And where unemployment rates fall to 10.2% in the US.  Hospitality, medical fields, leisure, and government jobs saw the biggest job gains. Unemployment rates in the US: Adult men: 9.4%Adult women: 10.5%White workers: 9.2%Asian workers: 12.0%Hispanic workers: 12.9%Black workers: 14.6%3) Uber reported larger than expected losses for its 2nd quarter in 2020, this is due to the 75% drop in gross bookings for its Rides segment. They may have to postpone for profitability until next year, or until the COVID-19 pandemic is over.  Also reported that Uber eats gaining more revenue than Uber taxi services due to amid COVID-19 pandemic. 4) Indian-American student Randeep Hothi sues Tesla CEO Elon Musk. An Indian-American student and Tesla critic Randeep Hothi has sued Elon Musk  claiming that the accusation made by the Tesla CEO that he "almost killed" his factory employees is defamatory, the media reported. 5) Chief Minister of Gujarat Vijay Rupani announced the new industrial policy aims to boost job creation, manufacturing and create innovation and driven ecosystems in the state Gujarat.  Gujarat stands first in terms of the number of Industrial Entrepreneurship Memorandums. 6) Idea-Vodafone shares bounce back, shares close 7% higher after an initial loss.  Idea-Vodafone Reported widening of net loss to Rs 25,460 crore in the June quarter. Follow → Business Eagle space for more updated news.
